instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1286: What is A1286? A1286 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2009 , Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2255, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2330, 820-2532, 820-2523, 820-2533, 820-2850, 820-2915, 820-3330..
definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.SMC_TPAD_RST_L: What is SMC_TPAD_RST_L? SMC_TPAD_RST_L is a signal that comes from the trackpad that can reset the SMC when it is low.  _L means whatever before the _L in the signal name is asserted when it is low voltage, such as 0.0v to 0.5v. The trackpad having corrosion from liquid damage is a very common cause of no light on the magsafe charger & the system not turning on, when the trackpad or trackpad cable is corroded and holding this line down. .

threads.title: MACBOOK PRO <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>...part no:- <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B......not turn with power btn
threads.message:
Hi...i have another macbook pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>...part no is <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
The problem is ..not turn on with power btn...when i remove the battery ..its turn on automaticaly...everything working fine..also keyboard too working
but once i turn of the mac its not powering on with power btn....i check another keyboard ....same status

threads.title: MACBOOK PRO <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>...part no:- <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B......not turn with power btn
threads.message:
when i check the MB i found corottion on <RESISTOR>R5072</RESISTOR> & R 5082(these resistors are missing from board)....i replace the resistors and clear the area...
but again same problm.....

threads.title: MACBOOK PRO <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>...part no:- <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B......not turn with power btn
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> steady high?
If not, check <RESISTOR>R5070</RESISTOR>.

Does the board start with <RESISTOR>R5015</RESISTOR>/16 pads, instead of power button?
If yes, check <RESISTOR>R5710</RESISTOR>.

threads.title: MACBOOK PRO <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>...part no:- <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B......not turn with power btn
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>  showing 3.4 v
also try to short <RESISTOR>R5015</RESISTOR>/16....still same

threads.title: MACBOOK PRO <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>...part no:- <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B......not turn with power btn
threads.message: another intresting thing is ...when first time turn on the device(autiomatic on)...during that time if i press the pwr btn  long time...the system will be of...then again i trying to switch on the device with pwrbtn..its not turn on

threads.title: MACBOOK PRO <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>...part no:- <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B......not turn with power btn
threads.message:
Check <SIGNAL>SMC_TPAD_RST_L</SIGNAL> level.
Also try <RESISTOR>R5015</RESISTOR>/16 pads, disconnecting keyboard.

threads.title: MACBOOK PRO <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>...part no:- <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B......not turn with power btn
threads.message: HI....the problem is solved.....before i told you there is corrotion on <RESISTOR>R5072</RESISTOR> & <RESISTOR>R5083</RESISTOR>...when i check the board there is 3.42 v missing on one side of  <RESISTOR>R5072</RESISTOR>..i make a direct jumper from 3.42 line ...now the board is ok(may be track cut )...thanks for your support

threads.title: MACBOOK PRO <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>...part no:- <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B......not turn with power btn
threads.message: Thanks for feedback, was a really strange issue.
